article: a man s best friend may become his enemy. His children that he has _ with loving care may show no thanks. Those who are _ to us, those whom we trust with our happiness _ turn against their faith. The money that a man has, he may _ .It flies from him, perhaps when he needs it _ . a man s reputation may be lost in a moment of ill-considered _ . The people who would prefer to fall on their knees to do us honour when success is with us may be _ to throw the stone malice when failure settles upon our heads. The one absolutely _ friend that man can have in this selfish world, the one that never deserts him is his _ . a man s dog stands by him _ he is rich or poor, healthy or sick. He will sleep on the cold ground, _ the wintry winds blow and the snow drives hard, _ he may be near his master s side. He will _ the hand that has no food to offer. He guards the sleep of his poor master as if he _ a prince. When all other friends desert him , the dog _ . When reputation falls to pieces, he is as constant in his love as the sun in its journey _ the heavens.If the master becomes friendless and homeless, _ the faithful dog asks for is to be with him. And when _ takes his master in its embrace and his body _ away in the cold ground, there by the graveside will the dog be found, his head between his paws, his eyes sad but _ in watchfullness, faithful and true even in death.
